page.title: 03Young person's guide:FINTRY
page.content: {"There's nothing for young people". {"Going out at night is difficult". {"There should be a youth club for {people to have a chat with their {mates"."The Sports Club isn't quite {for us".}These direct quotes reflect Fintry teenager attitude - discontent with the lack of amenities. No proper public transport means a dependency on parents for mobility, emphasizing their feelings of living in a "lovely" geographic trap, from which it's difficult to escape, even into work. {"I'm bored because there are no jobs {and no buses". Even girls who,find work in hotels and catering in the area, face problems. {"I'm off to work but I've got to stay {overnight as Mum can't pick me up this {evening".}Not just a city problem national peer-group pressures are seen here,exacerbated by lack of transport.
